Banyak Aduan soal Pilkades, DPRD Kabupaten Bandung Bentuk Pansus Evaluasi
03 Nov 2019, 11:27 by Handri Handriansyah
SOREANG, (PR).- Dewan Perwakilan Rakyat Daerah (DPRD) Kabupaten Bandung akhirnya membentuk Panitia Khusus Evaluasi Pemilihan Kepala Desa Serentak 2019. Hal itu dilakukan menyikapi banyaknya pengaduan dari berbagai pihak terkait ketidakpuasan hasil penghitungan suara dan kinerja Panitia Pemilihan Kepala Desa (P2K).
Ketua Fraksi Golkar sekaligus Ketua Pansus Evaluasi Pilkades Serentak, Cecep Suhendar mengatakan, pansus tersebut dibentuk berdasarkan hasil kesepakatan para aggota dewan dalam rapat paripurna Badan Musyawarah (Bamus) DPRD Kabupaten Bandung, Jumat 1 November 2019 lalu. "Dalam paripurna ditetapkan delapan orang untuk menjadi anggota Pansus Evaluasi Pilkades," ujarnya saat dihubungi, Minggu 3 November 2019.
Selain dirinya sebagai ketua, Cecep melansir tujuh orang anggota Pansus Evaluasi Pilkades lainnya adalah Tedi Surahman (PKS) sebagai wakil ketua, Praniko Imam Sagita (Gerindra) sebagai sekretaris, serta Osin Permana (Demokrat), Eep Jamaludin (PAN), Erwin Gunawan (PDIP), Renie Rahayu Fauzy (PKB) dan Toni Permana (Nasdem) sebagai anggota. Dengan begitu Pansus tersebut telah diwakili oleh perwakilan setiap fraksi yang ada di DPRD Kabupaten Bandung.
Menurut Cecep, Pillkades Serentak Kabupaten Bandung Gelombang 3 2019 di 199 desa memang berjalan lancar tanpa hambatan apapun. Semua itu berkat solidnya komunikasi semua jajaran dan pihak terkait dengan semua elemen masyarakat. "Selain itu peran dan fungsi komunikasi P2KD di tingkat kabupaten dengan P2KD di tingkat desa terjalin cukup baik sehingga semua tahapan di 199 desa bisa dilaksanakan sesuai regulasi yang ada," ucapnya.
Meskipun demikian, Cecep mengakui bahwa kesusksesan tersebut masih menyisakan dampak di beberapa desa. Dampak tersebut berupa pengaduan terkait ketidakpuasan mereka terhadap kinerja P2KD dan hasil penghitungan suara.
Dampak tersebut mau tidak mau harus segera ditindaklanjuti dan dievaluasi agar tidak terjadi lagi pada Pilkades Serentak gelombang berikutnya di 2021. Apalagi sebelum itu, Kabupaten Bandung akan menjalani pesta demokrasi yang tak kalah besar berupa pemilihan bupati pada 2020 nanti.
Cecep menambahkan, permasalahan yang muncul dan diadukan oleh masyarakat beragam mulai dari level persiapan, pencalonan, pemungutan suara hingga penetapan. "Di tahapan pencalonan terjadi beberapa permasalahan yang diakibatkan oleh kesalahan manusia (human error)," ujarnya.
Kesalahan tersebut terutama pada penetapan bakal calon yang sebelumnya lebih dari lima orang. Cecep melansir tak sedikit pengaduan yang menyebutkan bahwa panitia salah menjumlahkan nilai pembobotan dari lima indikator sesuai regulasi, sehingga akhirnya terjadi kesalahan dalam penetapan keputusan bakal calon yang lolos ke fase calon.
Pengaduan paling banyak, adalah terkait tahapan pemungutan dan penghitungan suara sehingga berdampak pada ketidakpuasan hasil raihan suara. "Pengaduan di tahap ini meliputi masalah terkait daftar pemilihan tetap (DPT), tempat dan mekanisme penghitungan suara, sistem kampanye dan tahapan Pilkades," kata Cecep.
Berdasarkan hal itulah, ujar Cecep, DPRD Kabupaten Bandung akhirnya sepakat membentuk pansus untuk mengevaluasi dan menyelesaikan semua permasalahan yang masih terjadi seputar pilkades. "Bagaimanapun, DPRD sebagai representasi masyarakat harus menjalankan fungsinya dalam menampung dan menyalurkan aspirasi masyarakat serta segera memahami dan menyelesaikan permasalahan pilkades," ucapnya.
Seperti diketahui, ketidakpuasan terhadap kinerja P2KD memang semakin marak bermunculan setelah proses penghitungan suara. Namun sebelum itu, pengaduan juga tak jarang terjadi terutama terkait pungutan dari P2KD terhadap bakal calon menjelang seleksi yang melibatkan akademisi.
Pascapencoblosan, aduan masyarakat pun kembali bermunculan terkait indikasi kecurangan yang dilakukan P2KD di beberapa desa. Terutama dengan jumlah surat suara tidak sah yang jumlahnya fantastis melebihi pileg dan pilpres 2018 lalu.***

Many Complaints about Pilkades, Bandung District Parliament Forms Special Evaluation Committee
03 Nov 2019, 11:27 by Handri Handriansyah
SOREANG, (PR) .- The Regional Representative Council (DPRD) of Bandung Regency finally formed the Special Evaluation Committee for the 2019 Simultaneous Village Head Election. This was done in response to the many complaints from various parties related to dissatisfaction of the vote count results and the performance of the Village Head Election Committee (P2K) .
Chairman of the Golkar Faction and Chair of the Evaluation Committee for the Simultaneous Pilkades, Cecep Suhendar said, the committee was formed based on the agreement of the members of the council members in the plenary meeting of the Bandung District Parliament Council (DPRD), Friday 1 November 2019. "In the plenary session eight people were determined to become members of the Pilkades Evaluation Committee," he said when contacted, Sunday 3 November 2019.
Aside from himself as chairman, Cecep reported seven members of the Pilkades Evaluation Special Committee were Tedi Surahman (PKS) as deputy chairman, Praniko Imam Sagita (Gerindra) as secretary, and Osin Permana (Democrat), Eep Jamaludin (PAN), Erwin Gunawan (PDIP) ), Renie Rahayu Fauzy (PKB) and Toni Permana (Nasdem) as members. That way the Special Committee has been represented by representatives of each faction in the Bandung Regency DPRD.
According to Cecep, Pillkades Simultaneous Bandung Regency Wave 3 2019 in 199 villages did run smoothly without any obstacles. All of that thanks to the solid communication of all levels and parties related to all elements of society. "In addition, the role and function of P2KD communication at the district level with P2KD at the village level is quite good so that all stages in 199 villages can be carried out according to existing regulations," he said.
Nevertheless, Cecep acknowledged that the success still had an impact in several villages. The impact was in the form of complaints related to their dissatisfaction with the P2KD's performance and the results of the vote count.
These impacts inevitably have to be immediately followed up and evaluated so as not to happen again in the next wave of Pilkades Simultaneously in 2021. Especially before that, Bandung Regency will undergo a democratic party that is no less massive in the form of a regent election in 2020.
Cecep added, the problems that emerged and were complained by the community varied from the level of preparation, nomination, voting to determination. "In the nomination stage, there are several problems caused by human error," he said.
The error is mainly in the determination of prospective candidates who previously had more than five people. Cecep reported that there were many complaints stating that the committee incorrectly summed the weighting values of the five indicators according to regulations, so that eventually there was an error in determining the decision of prospective candidates who passed to the candidate phase.
The most complaints are related to the stages of voting and counting of votes so that it results in dissatisfaction of the results of the vote. "Complaints at this stage include issues related to the permanent election list (DPT), the place and mechanism of vote counting, the campaign system and the stages of the Pilkades," said Cecep.
Based on that, said Cecep, Bandung Regency DPRD finally agreed to form a special committee to evaluate and resolve all problems that still occur around the village head election. "However, the DPRD as a representative of the community must carry out its function in accommodating and channeling the aspirations of the community and immediately understanding and resolving the pilkades problem," he said.
As is known, dissatisfaction with the P2KD's performance has indeed increased since the vote counting process. But before that, complaints were also not uncommon, especially related to the levies from P2KD on prospective candidates ahead of the selection involving academics.
After the voting, there were community complaints again that emerged regarding indications of fraud committed by the P2KD in several villages. Especially with the number of invalid ballots whose numbers are fantastic beyond the 2018 legislative and presidential elections. ***
